connector.description: Send and receive Twitter direct messages.

camel.sink.path.user.name: camel.sink.path.user
camel.sink.path.user.description: The user name to send a direct message. This will be ignored for consumer.

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.httpProxyHost.name: camel.sink.endpoint.httpProxyHost
camel.sink.endpoint.httpProxyHost.description: The http proxy host which can be used for the camel-twitter. Can also be configured on the TwitterComponent level instead.

camel.sink.endpoint.httpProxyPassword.name: camel.sink.endpoint.httpProxyPassword
camel.sink.endpoint.httpProxyPassword.description: The http proxy password which can be used for the camel-twitter. Can also be configured on the TwitterComponent level instead.

camel.sink.endpoint.httpProxyPort.name: camel.sink.endpoint.httpProxyPort
camel.sink.endpoint.httpProxyPort.description: The http proxy port which can be used for the camel-twitter. Can also be configured on the TwitterComponent level instead.

camel.sink.endpoint.httpProxyUser.name: camel.sink.endpoint.httpProxyUser
camel.sink.endpoint.httpProxyUser.description: The http proxy user which can be used for the camel-twitter. Can also be configured on the TwitterComponent level instead.

camel.sink.endpoint.accessToken.name: camel.sink.endpoint.accessToken
camel.sink.endpoint.accessToken.description: The access token. Can also be configured on the TwitterComponent level instead.

camel.sink.endpoint.accessTokenSecret.name: camel.sink.endpoint.accessTokenSecret
camel.sink.endpoint.accessTokenSecret.description: The access secret. Can also be configured on the TwitterComponent level instead.

camel.sink.endpoint.consumerKey.name: camel.sink.endpoint.consumerKey
camel.sink.endpoint.consumerKey.description: The consumer key. Can also be configured on the TwitterComponent level instead.

camel.sink.endpoint.consumerSecret.name: camel.sink.endpoint.consumerSecret
camel.sink.endpoint.consumerSecret.description: The consumer secret. Can also be configured on the TwitterComponent level instead.

camel.component.twitter-directmessage.la.name: camel.component.twitter-directmessage.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.twitter-directmessage.la.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.twitter-directmessage.au.name: camel.component.twitter-directmessage.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.twitter-directmessage.au.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.twitter-directmessage.ht.name: camel.component.twitter-directmessage.httpProxyHost
camel.component.twitter-directmessage.ht.description: The http proxy host which can be used for the camel-twitter.

camel.component.twitter-directmessage.ht.name: camel.component.twitter-directmessage.httpProxyPassword
camel.component.twitter-directmessage.ht.description: The http proxy password which can be used for the camel-twitter.

camel.component.twitter-directmessage.ht.name: camel.component.twitter-directmessage.httpProxyPort
camel.component.twitter-directmessage.ht.description: The http proxy port which can be used for the camel-twitter.

camel.component.twitter-directmessage.ht.name: camel.component.twitter-directmessage.httpProxyUser
camel.component.twitter-directmessage.ht.description: The http proxy user which can be used for the camel-twitter.
